In spring of 2006, Palladino toured with Jeff Beck. He appears on Jeff Beck's 2010 album, Emotion & Commotion.
The J. J. Cale, and Eric Clapton 2006 album The Road to Escondido,
Palladino joined Eric Clapton's touring band for 11 dates in the Eastern US and Canada in May 2008.
As of August 2010, Palladino has been touring with Herbie Hancock.
recording with Steve Gadd; Edie Brickell; Andy Fairweather Low; who have formed a group the Gaddabouts.
In January 2011, Palladino entered the studio with D'Angelo to finish recording the long overdue follow up to Voodoo.
In January and February 2012, Palladino joined D'Angelo's live band for a short European tour, alongside drummer Chris 'Daddy' Dave and guitarist Jesse Johnson.
Palladino played on the second album of Adele: 21, released in 2011
In late 2012, Palladino toured with the Who on their Quadrophenia 'revival' tour
